intro: Cacalia arguta, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, blue or purple flowers. It has hairy stems and leaves that are narrow and pointed. Cacalia arguta is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
